content: Got it, thank you. How should we begin?
Thanks for asking! To start, how about you tell me a little about what's on your mind today? What's been going well for you lately or anything you'd like to explore together?

Honestly, I've been feeling pretty overwhelmed. I haven't been sleeping well because I can't stop worrying about work. I'm stressed about potentially getting fired and how that would affect my family, especially since I have two young kids. My partner thought talking to you might help, but I’m not sure where to even start.

That sounds like a really heavy load to carry. Feeling overwhelmed, worrying about work, and being concerned for your family’s well-being—especially with young kids—can make it hard to find any peace. It makes sense that it's been affecting your sleep too. Thank you for sharing this with me. What has been the hardest part of all this for you?

I think the hardest part is just the uncertainty of it all. Not knowing if I’ll have a job next month or if I’ll be able to provide for my family keeps me up at night. It’s like my thoughts are going in circles, and I can’t turn them off. By the time I finally fall asleep, it’s already time to wake up. It makes me feel like I’m failing as a parent and partner.

That sounds incredibly difficult—both the weight of worrying about your job and the feeling of not being able to "turn off" your thoughts. The lack of sleep must also make it even harder to cope, leaving you drained and with less energy for your family. You clearly care deeply about being there for them, and it’s tough to feel like you're not meeting your own high expectations. How have you been getting through all of this so far?

Mostly, I just try to push through the day, even though I feel exhausted all the time. I tell myself I need to stay strong for my family, but honestly, it’s starting to feel like I'm just barely holding it together. I try not to let my kids or my partner see how stressed I am, but I don't think I'm doing a great job of hiding it anymore.

It sounds like you're carrying a lot on your shoulders, trying to keep everything together for your family while struggling with your own stress and exhaustion. That must take so much energy and strength. Even though it's been so tough, you've still been trying to show up for your family, and that really speaks to how much they mean to you. Have there been moments or things that have helped you feel even a little more at ease, even temporarily?

Not really, to be honest. I've tried things like watching TV or scrolling through my phone to distract myself, but it doesn't really help. Sometimes I think about talking to my partner about how I'm feeling, but I don't want to worry them more than they already are. It just feels like there's no escape from all these thoughts.

It sounds like you’ve been trying to find ways to cope, even if they don’t bring the relief you’re looking for. It’s hard to carry this alone, especially when you’re putting so much effort into protecting your partner and family from your worries. That concern for them shows how much you care, but it can also leave you feeling stuck with everything inside. When you think about opening up to your partner, what makes that feel difficult?
